thread.title: Newcastle 3-1 Birmingham: Ritchie brace and Gouffran stunner see Magpies book Oxford tie
thread.title_full: Newcastle 3-1 Birmingham: Ritchie brace and Gouffran stunner see Magpies book Oxford tie

author: Simon Bird
title: Newcastle 3-1 Birmingham: Ritchie brace and Gouffran stunner see Magpies book Oxford tie
text:
The Magpies have sealed their place in the next round (Photo: PA) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jonjo Shelvey returned from a five game ban to inspire Newcastle to their first FA Cup win for five years. 
The midfielder let his feet do the talking, shaking off the rust from his month long absence, by creating three goals. 
Shelvey was handed the captaincy for the night by boss Rafa Benitez. 
That showed firm backing for the star man after a suspension for using racially abusive language earlier in the season. 
The 24-year-old helped Yoan Gouffran win a penalty, coverted by Matt Ritchie. Then he set up Gouffran for the second goal of a comfortable win – their first in this competition since January 2012. Gouffran was brought down in the box after nine minutes (Photo: PA) Matt Ritchie made no mistake from the spot (Photo: Getty) 
In injury time Shelvey crossed from the byline to give Ritchie a tap in, his second of the night, and eight for the season. 
New boss Gianfranco Zola has not won any of his seven games in charge since succeeding sacked Gary Rowett, but got a consolation from David Cotterill. 
Shelvey showed what Newcastle, who now play Oxford United in the fourth round, have missed after eight minutes. 
He unpicked the visiting defence with a pass the sent Gouffran, unusually playing as a striker, through on goal. Yoan Gouffran nets his spectacular winner (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) 
Keeper Adam Legzdins brought him down and Ritchie stepped up to convert the penalty kick. 
Shelvey came close to scoring with a brilliant 40 yard volley that Legzdins scrambled away. 
Then he made Newcastle's second after 35 minutes for Gouffran. 
The French star is fighting for a new contract and impressed up front on his own with slick movement. 
He wriggled clear to collect a Shelvey free kick, flicked the ball up and volleyed home to give United a cushion. 
Gouffran is one of the players who has thrived under Benitez and could be worth hanging on to as a squad man next season when he is out of contract. Benitez and Zola chew the fat pre-game (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) 
It was the club's weakest cup line up for eight years, with three debutants including Neymar and Cristiano Ronaldo advert body double Yasin Ben El-Mhanni, who showed the odd trick. 
Debutant defender Stuart Findlay was assured, and midfielder Dan Barlaser hit one superb through ball. 
Zola made six changed himself and David Cotterill has their best early effort then got a goal after 71 minutes. 
He volleyed home when Maikel Kieftenbeld headed down Lukas Jutkiewicz' pass. 
Ritchie gave the performance a more realistic gloss with his second deep in injury time. Player ratings 
Newcastle : Sels 7, Yedlin 7 (Hayden 75), Hanley 7, Findlay 7, Lazaar 7 – Tiote 7 (Colback 83)– Ritchie 8, Shelvey 8, Barlaser 7, El-Mhanni 6 (Perez 70) – Gouffran 7 
Subs : Dummett, Lascelles, Elliot, Murphy 
Birmingham : Legzdins 5, Dacres-Cogley 5, Robinson 6, Shotton 5, Grounds 5– Cotterill 7, Davis 5 (Brown 63), Tesche 5, Kieftenbeld (Fabrini 80) 6, Adams 5 – Solomon-Otabor 5 (Jutkiewicz 63 6) 
Subs : Gleeson, Spector, Morrison, Kuszczak poll loading Will Newcastle win the Championship? 2000+ VOTES SO FAR
